org.fujion.highcharts

Class DataLabelOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.highcharts.DataLabelOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter, IClientTransform

    public class DataLabelOptions
extends Options
    Options for data labels.

    • Field Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        transformForClient

    • Field Detail

      • align

        @Option
public AlignHorizontal align
        The alignment of the data label compared to the point. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to "center".

      • allowOverlap

        @Option
public Boolean allowOverlap
        Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0. Defaults to false.

      • backgroundColor

        @Option
public String backgroundColor
        The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

      • borderColor

        @Option
public String borderColor
        The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

      • borderRadius

        @Option
public Integer borderRadius
        The border radius in pixels for the data label. Defaults to 0.

      • borderWidth

        @Option
public Integer borderWidth
        The border width in pixels for the data label. Defaults to 0.

      • className

        @Option
public String className
        A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow. Defaults to undefined.

      • color

        @Option
public String color
        The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

      • crop

        @Option
public Boolean crop
        Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option. Defaults to true.

      • defer

        @Option
public Boolean defer
        Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished. Defaults to true.

      • enabled

        @Option
public Boolean enabled
        Enable or disable the data labels. Defaults to false.

      • format

        @Option
public String format
        A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter. Defaults to {y}.

      • formatter

        @Option(convertTo=JavaScript.class)
public String formatter
        Callback JavaScript function to format the data label.

      • inside

        @Option
public Boolean inside
        For points with an extent, like columns or map areas, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns. Defaults to undefined.

      • overflow

        @Option
public String overflow
        How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal axis. Can be undefined or "justify". If "justify", labels will not render outside the plot area. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed. Defaults to undefined.

      • padding

        @Option
public Integer padding
        When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box. Defaults to 2. Defaults to 2.

      • rotation

        @Option
public Integer rotation
        Rotation of the labels in degrees. Defaults to 0.

      • shadow

        @Option
public Object shadow
        The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. The shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

      • shape

        @Option
public String shape
        The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object. Defaults to square.

      • style

        @Option
public final StyleOptions style
        CSS styles for the label.

      • useHTML

        @Option
public Boolean useHTML
        Whether to use HTML to render the labels. Defaults to false.

      • verticalAlign

        @Option
public AlignVertical verticalAlign
        The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values. Defaults to bottom.

      • x

        @Option
public Integer x
        The x position offset of the label relative to the point. Defaults to 0.

      • y

        @Option
public Integer y
        The y position offset of the label relative to the point. Defaults to -6.

      • zIndex

        @Option
public Integer zIndex
        The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series. Defaults to 6.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataLabelOptions

        public DataLabelOptions()
